data.title: A little taste of heaven....and Hawaii
data.text: This isn't your average sno cone stand.  THIS is shaved ice.  YES there is a difference.  It is fluffy and light and a little piece of heaven.  I first experienced it in Hawaii and when I saw the stands here, I just about flipped...and then when I saw one right down the street....I knew I was in trouble.  You can get them with just the shaved ice and flavor, or you can get them true island style with a scoop of vanilla, coconut or macadamia nut ice cream in the bottom of the cup, the shaved ice, your favorite flavor of syrup( or two, there are 50 flavors to choose from!) and then you can top it off with a sno cap, which is sweetened condensed milk, or a spritz of sour spray, or a sprinkle of Li Hing Muy Powder which is a little bit sweet, a little bit salty, and a little bit sour!!!  Heaven....

data.title: Good as being in Hawaii
data.text: Having recently experienced Shave Ice for the first time in Hawaii, we were delighted when Hokulia's opened up a shave ice shack a few blocks from our home, in the parking lot of a nearby Domino's. We were quick to go check it out. They have a bazillion flavors and combinations and you can get ice cream and/or sno cap added to it if you'd like. The prices seem reasonable and the flavors are delicious. The service was friendly and efficient. The ice is finely shaved rather than crushed, so no ice bits. It absorbs the syrups really well with a nice texture. We ordered the Big Kahuna size, Black Cherry and Pineapple and shared it between 2 of us. Very Nice!! :)  We'll be back.

owner_response.author: Stephanie W, Manager at Hokulia Shave Ice, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We're so happy you had such a positive experience at Hokulia! We too love our 50 delicious flavors imported from Hawaii and made with 100% pure cane sugar. Mahalo!
